author: nhcwebmaster@noaa.gov (NHC Webmaster)
nhc_headline: ...BERYL STRENGTHENING AS THE CENTER APPROACHES THE MIDDLE TEXAS  COAST... ...CONDITIONS DETERIORATING WITH DANGEROUS STORM SURGE, FLASH  FLOODING, AND STRONG WINDS EXPECTED...
summary:
...BERYL STRENGTHENING AS THE CENTER APPROACHES THE MIDDLE TEXAS  COAST... ...CONDITIONS DETERIORATING WITH DANGEROUS STORM SURGE, FLASH  FLOODING, AND STRONG WINDS EXPECTED...
 As of 1:00 AM CDT Mon Jul 8
 the center of Beryl was located near 28.2, -95.9
 with movement NNW at 10 mph.
 The minimum central pressure was 984 mb
 with maximum sustained winds of about 80 mph.
